page.title: 15Hardwick Estate
page.content: The estate occupies some 560 acres in a belt between Ellesmere and Frankton. Owned by Colonel Kynaston it now comprises three farms,one devoted to arable,one to doing and one to dry stock.There are also estate cottages at Perthy.There are about 40 acres of woodland on the estate, much of it around the hall itself.There is also a large pool and several smaller ones. In the current year some 220 acres were devoted to cereal,60 acres to peas(for both animal and human consumption)and the rest is lay grass. The estate is worked by a labour force of 6,one of whom is also responsible for the lawns etc at the Hall.The Hall,much altered in its time ,is still a very fine country house and stands in a position enjoying views across the estate itself.
